alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 3:35PM MST until February 08 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Natrona County in central Wyoming... Extreme Southeastern Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 415 PM MST. * At 334 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Antelope Hills, or 18 miles north of Casper, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 176 and 231. Locations impacted include... Casper, Mills, Evansville, Bar Nunn, Midwest, Homa Hills, Edgerton, Antelope Hills, Teapot Rock, Paradise Valley, and Casper Mountain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
